sentences.text: Patient presents with fever, chills, and body aches.
Examination reveals tenderness in the right lower quadrant.
Blood pressure is elevated at 160/100 mmHg.
Lab results indicate elevated levels of C-reactive protein.
X-ray shows bilateral infiltrates consistent with pneumonia.
Patient complains of persistent cough with yellow-green sputum.
Auscultation reveals diminished breath sounds in the left lung base.
ECG shows sinus bradycardia with occasional premature ventricular contractions.
MRI reveals a herniated disc at the L4-L5 level.
Patient reports sudden onset of severe headache with photophobia.
CT scan demonstrates a subarachnoid hemorrhage.
Blood glucose level is 300 mg/dL, consistent with uncontrolled diabetes.
Fundoscopic exam reveals papilledema.
Patient presents with sudden onset weakness and slurred speech.
Neurological exam shows right-sided hemiparesis.
MRI confirms acute ischemic stroke in the left middle cerebral artery territory.
Patient reports episodes of chest pain radiating to the left arm.
Troponin levels are elevated, suggestive of myocardial infarction.
Echocardiogram shows decreased ejection fraction of 35%.
Patient presents with abdominal pain and nausea after meals.
Ultrasound reveals cholelithiasis with gallbladder wall thickening.
Blood tests show elevated liver enzymes.
Patient complains of chronic joint pain and stiffness.
Examination reveals bilateral swelling and tenderness in the wrists.
X-ray shows erosive changes consistent with rheumatoid arthritis.
Patient presents with a rash on the trunk and extremities.
Skin biopsy confirms a diagnosis of psoriasis.
Patient reports frequent episodes of heartburn and regurgitation.
Endoscopy reveals esophagitis with erosive changes.
Patient presents with polyuria and polydipsia.
Urinalysis shows glycosuria and ketonuria.
HbA1c level is elevated at 10.2%, indicating poor glycemic control.
Patient complains of blurred vision and difficulty focusing.
Ophthalmologic exam reveals diabetic retinopathy.
Patient reports persistent fatigue and weight gain.
Thyroid function tests indicate hypothyroidism.
Patient presents with a sore throat and swollen lymph nodes.
Rapid strep test is positive for Group A Streptococcus.
Patient reports intermittent diarrhea with blood and mucus.
Stool sample tests positive for Clostridium difficile toxin.
Patient presents with generalized itching and jaundice.
Liver function tests show elevated bilirubin levels.
Patient complains of dyspnea on exertion and orthopnea.
Chest X-ray reveals cardiomegaly with pulmonary edema.
Patient reports frequent urination and nocturia.
Urinalysis indicates proteinuria and microscopic hematuria.
Renal ultrasound shows bilateral renal artery stenosis.
Patient presents with abdominal distension and ascites.
CT scan demonstrates cirrhotic liver with portal hypertension.
Patient reports episodes of anxiety and panic attacks.
Mental status exam reveals obsessive-compulsive tendencies.
Patient presents with severe abdominal pain and rebound tenderness.
CT scan shows acute appendicitis with peri-appendiceal fluid.
Patient complains of chronic low back pain radiating down the leg.
Physical exam reveals decreased sensation in the L5 dermatome.
MRI confirms lumbar disc herniation compressing the L5 nerve root.
Patient presents with sudden onset dyspnea and pleuritic chest pain.
CT pulmonary angiography reveals a pulmonary embolism in the right main pulmonary artery.
Patient reports recurrent urinary tract infections.
Urinalysis shows pyuria and bacteriuria.
Renal ultrasound demonstrates bilateral hydronephrosis.
Patient presents with a productive cough and hemoptysis.
Chest X-ray shows cavitary lesions consistent with tuberculosis.
Patient complains of pain and stiffness in the hands and feet.
Rheumatoid factor is positive with elevated anti-CCP antibodies.
X-ray reveals erosive changes and joint space narrowing in the hands.
Patient presents with epigastric pain and melena.
Upper endoscopy reveals a duodenal ulcer with active bleeding.
Patient reports muscle weakness and easy fatigability.
Creatine kinase levels are elevated, suggestive of myositis.
EMG shows myopathic changes consistent with polymyositis.
Patient presents with recurrent fevers and night sweats.
Tuberculin skin test is positive with a 20 mm induration.
Chest X-ray shows bilateral upper lobe infiltrates.
Patient complains of burning sensation and paresthesias in the feet.
Nerve conduction studies reveal peripheral neuropathy.
Patient presents with a history of multiple syncopal episodes.
Holter monitor shows episodes of sinus arrest.
Patient reports pain and stiffness in the shoulders and hips.
ESR and CRP levels are elevated, suggestive of polymyalgia rheumatica.
MRI of the brain shows multiple enhancing lesions.
Lumbar puncture reveals oligoclonal bands in the cerebrospinal fluid.
Patient presents with recurrent oral ulcers and genital lesions.
Serologic testing is positive for herpes simplex virus type 2.
Patient complains of difficulty initiating and maintaining sleep.
Polysomnography demonstrates frequent awakenings and reduced REM sleep.
Patient presents with abdominal discomfort and bloating.
Colonoscopy reveals skip lesions and aphthous ulcers in the terminal ileum.
Patient reports gradual onset dysphagia to solids and liquids.
Barium swallow shows a dilated esophagus with tertiary contractions.
Patient presents with decreased appetite and unintentional weight loss.
CBC reveals microcytic hypochromic anemia with a low ferritin level.
Patient complains of pain and stiffness in the temporomandibular joint.
Examination reveals crepitus and limited range of motion in the jaw.
Patient reports recurrent headaches associated with visual disturbances.
Ophthalmologic exam shows optic disc swelling and visual field defects.
Patient presents with swelling and tenderness in the calf.
Doppler ultrasound confirms deep vein thrombosis in the left lower extremity.
Patient complains of abdominal cramping and diarrhea after dairy consumption.
Lactose intolerance is suspected and confirmed with a hydrogen breath test.
Patient presents with recurrent episodes of vertigo and nausea.
Dix-Hallpike maneuver elicits nystagmus consistent with benign paroxysmal positional vertigo.
Patient complains of abdominal pain relieved by defecation and associated with changes in bowel habits.
Rome IV criteria are met for the diagnosis of irritable bowel syndrome.
Patient presents with a history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.
Pulmonary function tests reveal decreased forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) and FEV1/forced vital capacity ratio.
Patient reports swelling and tenderness in multiple joints bilaterally.
ANA titer is elevated with a speckled pattern, suggestive of systemic lupus erythematosus.
Patient presents with sudden onset severe abdominal pain and vomiting.
Abdominal CT scan demonstrates a small bowel obstruction with transition point.
Patient complains of gradual onset dyspnea on exertion and dry cough.
High-resolution CT scan shows bilateral ground-glass opacities and reticular pattern consistent with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.
Patient presents with itching and burning rash in a linear distribution.
Skin biopsy confirms the diagnosis of dermatitis herpetiformis.
Patient reports gradual onset weakness and muscle wasting in the proximal limbs.
Electromyography reveals myopathic changes consistent with dermatomyositis.
Patient presents with recurrent episodes of severe abdominal pain and diarrhea.
Colonoscopy reveals skip lesions and cobblestone appearance consistent with Crohn's disease.
Patient complains of persistent cough with blood-streaked sputum.
CT scan demonstrates a solitary pulmonary nodule in the right upper lobe.
Patient presents with swollen, tender, and warm joints.
Synovial fluid analysis shows elevated leukocyte count with negative crystals, suggestive of septic arthritis.
Patient reports recurrent episodes of severe, pulsating headaches.
MRI reveals a pituitary adenoma compressing the optic chiasm.
Patient presents with abdominal pain and distension.
Abdominal ultrasound shows ascites and hepatomegaly.
Patient complains of difficulty walking and frequent falls.
MRI of the spine demonstrates cervical spondylosis with spinal cord compression.
Patient presents with pain and swelling in the calf.
Doppler ultrasound confirms superficial thrombophlebitis.
Patient reports chronic dryness and irritation of the eyes.
Schirmer's test reveals decreased tear production, consistent with Sjogren's syndrome.
Patient presents with recurrent, painful oral ulcers.
Serologic testing is positive for antibodies to nuclear antigens.
Patient complains of chronic fatigue and muscle aches.
Fibromyalgia is suspected based on tender points and widespread pain.
Patient presents with hoarseness and difficulty swallowing.
Laryngoscopy reveals vocal cord nodules and esophageal strictures.
Patient reports episodes of blurred vision and double vision.
MRI of the brain shows demyelinating lesions consistent with multiple sclerosis.
Patient presents with excessive thirst and frequent urination.
Serum osmolality is elevated with low urine osmolality, suggestive of diabetes insipidus.
Patient complains of pain and swelling in the knee joint.
Knee aspiration reveals turbid fluid with elevated leukocyte count, suggestive of septic arthritis.
Patient presents with chronic cough and wheezing.
Spirometry shows reversible airflow obstruction consistent with asthma.
Patient reports frequent urination and nocturnal enuresis.
Urodynamic studies reveal detrusor instability and impaired bladder emptying.
Patient presents with a history of recurrent kidney stones.
24-hour urine collection shows elevated levels of calcium oxalate and uric acid.
Patient complains of persistent epigastric pain and bloating.
Upper endoscopy reveals erosive gastritis and duodenal ulcers.
Patient presents with a history of multiple syncopal episodes.
Holter monitor shows episodes of sinus bradycardia and pauses.
Patient reports swelling and pain in the fingers and toes.
Capillaroscopy reveals dilated and tortuous nailfold capillaries, suggestive of systemic sclerosis.
Patient presents with fever, sore throat, and cervical lymphadenopathy.
Monospot test is positive for Epstein-Barr virus.
Patient complains of joint stiffness and limited range of motion.
X-ray shows joint space narrowing and osteophyte formation consistent with osteoarthritis.
Patient presents with sudden onset severe abdominal pain and hematemesis.
Upper GI endoscopy reveals esophageal varices with stigmata of recent bleeding.
Patient reports progressive hearing loss and tinnitus.
Audiogram shows bilateral sensorineural hearing loss.
Patient presents with chest pain and shortness of breath.
Coronary angiography reveals 80% stenosis of the left anterior descending artery.
Patient complains of difficulty swallowing solid foods.
Barium swallow shows esophageal strictures and narrowing.
Patient presents with recurrent, painful mouth ulcers.
CBC reveals pancytopenia with hypocellular bone marrow, suggestive of aplastic anemia.
Patient reports chronic joint pain and morning stiffness.
HLA-B27 testing is positive, consistent with ankylosing spondylitis.
Patient presents with a history of recurrent seizures.
EEG shows epileptiform discharges originating from the left temporal lobe.
Patient complains of abdominal discomfort and bloating after meals.
Gastric emptying study reveals delayed gastric emptying, suggestive of gastroparesis.
Patient presents with chronic, non-healing wounds on the lower extremities.
Doppler ultrasound shows arterial insufficiency with ankle-brachial index < 0.9.
Patient reports persistent cough and wheezing exacerbated by cold air.
Pulmonary function tests demonstrate reversible airflow obstruction consistent with allergic asthma.
Patient presents with recurrent, painful swelling of the parotid glands.
Salivary gland biopsy reveals lymphocytic infiltration consistent with Sjogren's syndrome.
Patient complains of chronic abdominal pain and diarrhea.
Stool studies are positive for Giardia lamblia infection.
Patient presents with numbness and tingling in the hands and feet.
Nerve conduction studies show peripheral neuropathy with axonal involvement.
Patient reports recurrent, painful oral ulcers and genital lesions.
PCR testing confirms herpes simplex virus type 1 infection.
Patient presents with difficulty initiating and maintaining sleep.
Polysomnography shows decreased total sleep time and frequent arousals.
Patient complains of severe, throbbing headaches associated with nausea and vomiting.
